definition: to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)

sentences.english: The government agreed to backstop companies that invested in oil exploration.
sentences.chinese: 政府同意支持那些對石油勘查投資的公司。

sentences.english: Reconnoitring and collecting evidence is the first step to castigate such crime .
sentences.chinese: 勘查與取證是打擊計算機犯罪的第一步。

sentences.english: Tube wave detecting method is a newly developed geophysical detecting method.
sentences.chinese: 管波探測法是新興的地球物理勘查方法。

sentences.english: Geological explor(?)tion is regarded by the author as a basis for pre-phase programming and management of natural resource.
sentences.chinese: 本文認爲地質勘查是國土規劃和整治的前期基礎工作。

sentences.english: Following an on-site inspection, the surveyor prepared a written report on the property.
sentences.chinese: 勘查之後，測量員出具了這一地產的書面報告。

sentences.english: Pope turns and addresses a man investigating the door to the infirmary.
sentences.chinese: Pope轉身與勘查醫務室門的一個男子交談。

sentences.english: At the same time, the measure of ground Radon is proved to be an effective method in geothermal field exploration.
sentences.chinese: 同時指出地表氡氣測量是熱田勘查的有效途徑。

sentences.english: The bank was carefully cased by the bandits before the robbery.
sentences.chinese: 銀行在搶劫案發生之前曾被匪徒徹底勘查過。

sentences.english: This paper describes the application of shallow seismic refraction wave method to the exploration of foundation for railway bridges.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了淺層地震折射波法在鐵路橋基礎勘查中的應用。

sentences.english: We got success at a tr ial of some geological item.
sentences.chinese: 該方法在某地質勘查項目定點實驗中取得成功。

sentences.english: Therefore, it is urgency for selenium resources to be reinforced exploration, exploitation and utilization.
sentences.chinese: 在我國加強硒礦資源的勘查和開發利用已刻不容緩。

sentences.english: The traffic accident scene investigation system based on binocular stereovision is designed.
sentences.chinese: 設計了基於雙目系統的交通事故現場勘查系統。

sentences.english: The First Party of Hydrogeology and Engineering Geology, Guangdong Bureau of Geology and Mineral Investigation.
sentences.chinese: 廣東省地質勘查局水文工程地質一大隊。

sentences.english: The scene of the investigation, Wang Guozhong saw the body spit.
sentences.chinese: 衆人勘查現場，王國忠看到屍體吐了。

sentences.english: Three British explorers are about to embark on a survey to map the Arctic Ocean's sea-ice cover.
sentences.chinese: 三位英國探險家即將啓程對北冰洋海冰進行勘查。

sentences.english: The foreground of geothermal resources and the advantageous region for exploration were provided.
sentences.chinese: 指出蘭州坳陷地熱資源的前景和勘查有利地段。

definition: to explore/to survey/to prospect (for oil etc)/prospecting
to obtain (information from an archive etc)
to go and inspect (a site)/to do an on-site survey
to inspect/to run through a checklist/to take stock/to audit
investigation/inquiry/to investigate/to survey/survey/(opinion) poll/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to cause an accident/to be responsible for an incident/to provoke a disturbance
to deploy surveillance/to put under surveillance
civil police/PRC police/abbr. for 人民警察
